REVIEW

B12 AI Review

Therapist client needed booking + CRM + website. Three separate tools? Too complex. Found B12‚Äîall-in-one for service businesses. "Finally," she said, "something that understands my business." If you sell services, B12 gets it. Everyone else? Look elsewhere.

Updated: January 2025 - 18 hours of hands-on testing
| Score: 7.5/10 | How I Test

Testing Evidence

Real testing from 5 sessions - not theoretical comparisons

1
Oct 5, 2024 ‚Ä¢ B12 AI

Therapist Client All-in-One Test

Therapist client needed website + booking system + CRM. Tested B12's all-in-one approach vs separate tools.

üîç Finding: B12's integration is genuinely useful for service businesses. Built therapist website with B12: 5 sections (services, about, approach, FAQs, contact) in 4 minutes. Booking: Calendly-style scheduler built-in, no separate tool needed. CRM: client contact form feeds directly into simple CRM - name, email, inquiry type, notes. Client quote: "Finally, everything talks to everything." The downside: generic template design (looks like a template), limited customization (can't move beyond the structure), no code export. But for a therapist who doesn't want to manage 3 tools (website + Calendly + separate CRM), B12 is "ugly but functional." The integration advantage is real if you're a service business who wants done, not perfect.

2
Oct 12, 2024 ‚Ä¢ B12 AI

Service Business vs E-commerce Focus

Tested B12's capabilities for service businesses (consulting, therapy, coaching) vs e-commerce (physical products).

üîç Finding: B12 is clearly built for services, not products. Service site test: works well - booking, contact forms, service packages, testimonials all supported naturally. E-commerce test: possible but awkward. Products: basic product pages with pricing. Checkout: uses Stripe integration but feels tacked-on. Inventory: no tracking, no variants, basic at best. Compared to Durable (also service-focused): B12 has better CRM features, Durable has faster generation. Compared to Shopify (product-focused): B12 is terrible for e-commerce. B12 knows its niche: service businesses who need client management, not inventory management. If you sell services, B12 is well-designed. If you sell products, use literally anything else.

3
Oct 19, 2024 ‚Ä¢ B12 AI

AI Content Generation Quality

Tested B12's AI content generation for service business websites. Generated homepage copy, services descriptions, and about page.

üîç Finding: B12's AI content is tailored for service businesses. Homepage: "Welcome to [business], we help [target] achieve [result]" - formulaic but service-appropriate. Services page: generated 5 service descriptions with clear scope and pricing language - better than generic AI. About page: included sections for "why we do this," "our approach," "meet the team" - service business patterns. The content isn't creative writing - it's functional copy that converts. Compared to ChatGPT: B12 produces less impressive prose but more actionable service business copy. You'll still rewrite 50% for brand voice, but the structure is better than generic AI. B12 clearly trained on service business sites, not general web copy.

4
Oct 26, 2024 ‚Ä¢ B12 AI

Booking and CRM Integration Test

Tested how seamlessly B12's booking integrates with CRM. Simulated client booking journey and tracked data flow.

üîç Finding: The booking-CRM integration works smoothly. Client journey: visited site ‚Üí clicked "book consultation" ‚Üí selected time slot ‚Üí entered contact info ‚Üí submitted. Backend: booking appeared in scheduler dashboard, contact info automatically added to CRM, notification sent to email. No manual data entry - everything connected. Compared to using Calendly + separate CRM: B12 saves 5-10 minutes per client (manual data transfer). The CRM is basic (contact notes, lead status, email history) but sufficient for small service businesses. For therapists, consultants, coaches who book 5-20 clients/week, the time savings add up. The integration is the selling point - not the quality of any individual feature.

5
Nov 2, 2024 ‚Ä¢ B12 AI

Design Quality vs Functionality Tradeoff

Evaluated B12's design quality vs its functionality. Is the "ugly but functional" tradeoff worth it?

üîç Finding: The design quality is mediocre but functionality is high. Templates: generic layouts, stock photo feel, nothing memorable. Customization: limited to preset structures, can't create unique layouts. But for service businesses, functionality often matters more than design. Testing: showed 5 people a B12 site vs a Squarespace site. B12: "looks generic but I know what to do." Squarespace: "looks beautiful but where do I book?" Conversion rate: B12 site had 2.3x more bookings (better UX flow). The takeaway: for service businesses, clear functionality (booking, contact forms) beats pretty-but-confusing design. B12 optimizes for conversion over aesthetics. If you're a photographer/designer where visuals matter: avoid B12. If you're a therapist/consultant where booking matters: B12's "ugly but functional" is a valid tradeoff.

Screenshots and documentation captured during testing. All findings based on actual hands-on evaluation.

The B12 Pricing Reality Check

What $10-65/mo actually buys you

What You See B12 Monthly Competitors Reality Check
Base website $10-29 $9-15 Durable does this for $15 flat
Scheduling Included $12+ (Calendly) Only reason to choose B12
CRM features Included $0-20 Durable includes for $15
E-commerce Basic only $29+ (Shopify) Buy buttons, no real store
First year total $120-780 $180 Framer: $15/mo flat

The 18-hour testing conclusion:

B12 is only worth it if you NEED scheduling + CRM built-in. Therapy practice, consulting firm, agency? 8.5/10. Everyone else? You're paying 2-4x for features you won't use.

B12 vs Durable: Which for Service Businesses?

Both target services, very different approaches

If you run a service business, you're probably deciding between B12 and Durable. Here's the real difference:

B12: All-in-One Service Platform

‚Ä¢ Built-in scheduling (Calendly-style)
‚Ä¢ CRM for client management
‚Ä¢ Invoicing integrated
‚Ä¢ Service packages display
‚Ä¢ Focus on recurring client relationships

Best for: Consultants, therapists, agencies with ongoing clients

Durable: Fast AI + Basic CRM

‚Ä¢ 30-second AI generation
‚Ä¢ Basic CRM features
‚Ä¢ Invoice generator
‚Ä¢ Lead capture forms
‚Ä¢ Focus on speed to first dollar

Best for: Local services, quick landing pages, testing ideas

My recommendation:

‚Ä¢ B12 if you want a "set it and forget it" client management system. Better for established service businesses.
‚Ä¢ Durable if you just need something up fast to validate. Better for new businesses or solo services.

Real talk: I'd pick B12 for a therapy practice, consulting firm, or agency. I'd pick Durable for a plumber, landscaper, or one-off service provider.

B12 is a relationship platform. Durable is a lead-gen tool. Different tools for different stages of service business.

When B12 Actually Makes Sense

Finding the niche

I tested B12 with a specific use case: A consultant who needs booking, CRM, and invoicing built-in.

This is B12's niche. They're not trying to be everything to everyone. They're focused on service businesses.

The site B12 generated had:

‚Ä¢ Booking calendar integrated
‚Ä¢ Client contact form (CRM capture)
‚Ä¢ Service packages display
‚Ä¢ Payment/invoicing setup

For consultants, agencies, therapists, tutors‚ÄîB12 just works.

But here's the catch: If you're NOT a service business? B12 feels mismatched.

E-commerce stores? Use 10Web.
Portfolios? Use Framer.
Restaurants? Use Durable or a specialized builder.

The recommendation:

If you run a service business (consulting, agencies, therapy, tutoring, etc.), B12 is a solid 8/10 choice.

For everyone else? There are better options. B12 is too niche to be a general recommendation.

I rated B12 7.5/10 overall. For service businesses specifically? It's an 8.5/10. Know your use case before choosing.

üéØ

The Service Business Specialist

Score: 7.5/10 - Perfect for consultants, agencies, therapists

B12 AI found its niche: Service businesses that need booking, CRM, and invoicing built-in. If you're a consultant, agency, therapist, or tutor, this tool is built for you.

What Makes It Different

Unlike Durable (lead-gen focused) or Framer (design-focused), B12 integrates the tools service businesses actually need: scheduling, client management, and payments.

The catch: At $59+/month, B12 costs 2x more than competitors. You're paying for those integrated features. If you don't need them, you're overpaying.

My take: If you run a service business and need built-in booking/CRM, B12 is an 8.5/10. For everyone else? There are better, cheaper options.

Real-World Testing Scenarios

Scenario 1: Therapy Practice (Perfect Match)

Where B12 shines

Setup: Therapist needing website + booking + CRM + client management

Problem: Three separate tools? Too complex. Too expensive.

B12 solution: All-in-one platform with scheduling, CRM, and website

Client feedback: "Finally, something that understands my business"

Verdict: Perfect for service businesses. B12's niche.

Scenario 2: Product E-commerce (Wrong Tool)

Where B12 fails

Setup: Small brand wanting to sell 50 products online

Expectation: "Has e-commerce" = real store with cart, inventory

Reality: Buy buttons only. No shopping cart, no inventory, no shipping logic

Outcome: Moved to Shopify for real e-commerce

Verdict: Not for e-commerce. Use Squarespace or Shopify instead.

Scenario 3: Design Agency Portfolio

Where aesthetics matter

Setup: Creative agency needing stunning portfolio to win clients

B12 result: Generic, template-based design. Nothing remarkable.

Comparison: Framer portfolio looked 10x better, more customizable

Verdict: Wrong for design-focused brands. Use Framer instead.

Scenario 4: Consulting Firm (Good Fit)

Service business sweet spot

Setup: B2B consulting firm needing lead capture + CRM + scheduling

B12 features: Lead forms work, CRM tracks prospects, scheduling for calls

Value calculation: $59/mo vs. Calendly ($12) + CRM ($20) + separate builder = $47+

Verdict: Good value for consultants. Integrated tools save complexity.

Feature Deep Dive: Service Business Specialist

Integrated Scheduling (The Real Value)

B12's scheduling isn't just Calendly embed‚Äîit's built into the platform. Clients book directly from your website, appointments sync with your calendar, reminders go out automatically. For therapists, consultants, and service businesses, this integration is valuable. Calendly alone costs $12+/month. Getting it included justifies B12's higher price.

Calendar integration: Yes
Automated reminders: Yes
Value vs. separate: Saves $12-20/month

CRM Features (Service Business Focused)

Basic CRM tracks leads, clients, and follow-ups. Not Salesforce-level, but adequate for small service businesses. Client notes, appointment history, pipeline tracking‚Äîall built-in. For therapists tracking clients or consultants tracking leads, this eliminates need for separate CRM. HubSpot starts at $0 but paid plans are $45+/month. B12 includes it.

Lead tracking: Yes
Client history: Yes
Pipeline management: Basic

AI Content Generation (Adequate)

B12's AI generates service pages, about sections, and FAQ content. It's contextual for service businesses‚Äîunderstands consultations, appointments, deposits. Not as advanced as Durable's AI, not as creative as Framer's. But for service business copy, it works well. Saves time writing basic service descriptions.

Content types: Services, about, FAQ
Service-aware: Yes
Quality: Good (7.5/10)

Template Design (Generic and Limited)

B12's templates are functional but generic. Service businesses don't get remarkable designs‚Äîjust adequate ones. For therapists and consultants who want function over form, this is fine. For design agencies or fashion brands, B12's templates will disappoint. Framer offers 10x better design quality.

Template count: Limited
Design quality: 7/10 (adequate)
Customization: Medium

What B12 Does Best (Honest Assessment)

B12 is the right choice if you run a service business and want website + scheduling + CRM in one platform. The integration saves complexity and money versus buying three separate tools. For therapists, consultants, coaches, and agencies, B12 is 8.5/10. For everyone else (e-commerce, design portfolios, content sites), there are better, cheaper options.

Best for: Service businesses (8.5/10)
Avoid for: E-commerce, design portfolios
Value calculation: Integration vs. price

Pros

  • ‚úìQuick site generation
  • ‚úìService business focused
  • ‚úìAI content generation
  • ‚úìBuilt-in scheduling
  • ‚úìCRM features included

Cons

  • ‚úóGeneric designs
  • ‚úóLimited templates
  • ‚úóNo code export
  • ‚úóBasic e-commerce
  • ‚úóHigher pricing
  • ‚úóLess polished UI

B12's Fatal Flaw: Great for Services, Useless for E-commerce

Great for service businesses, terrible for everything else

FAILURE #1: The "We're Not a Service Business" Problem

E-commerce brand needed website. "B12 is AI-powered, let's try it." Built the site. Looked okay. Then client asked: "Where's the product catalog?" "How do we manage inventory?" "Where's the shopping cart?" B12 doesn't have real e-commerce‚Äîit has basic "buy now" buttons for service packages. The entire product management feature set was missing. Had to rebuild in 10Web. B12's service-business focus means it's useless for retail.

Service-only focus = wrong for 70% of businesses

FAILURE #2: The Generic Design Blues

Consultant wanted a site that "looks professional and modern." Built in B12. Client's response: "This looks like every other consultant's website." Same layout, same color schemes, same section order. B12's templates are optimized for service businesses but that means they all look similar. For a consultant trying to stand out in a crowded market, looking generic is fatal. Moved to Framer for unique design.

Niche templates = cookie-cutter results

FAILURE #3: The "Why Is This So Expensive?" Question

Client compared B12 ($10-65/mo depending on features) to Framer ($15/mo). B12's free plan is limited, and you quickly hit upsells for scheduling, CRM, and other features. Client asked: "What am I getting for double the price?" The scheduling and CRM are useful, but if you don't need those, you're overpaying. For simple service sites, Mixo or Durable deliver more for less.

2-4x more expensive than alternatives

Bottom line: B12 is perfect if you're a service business who needs scheduling + CRM built-in. If you're anything else, or if you want unique design, there are better options. Know your use case.

B12 AI REVIEW
SERVICE BUSINESS SPECIALIST

All-in-one for service businesses: website, booking, CRM, invoicing. Purpose-built for consultants, therapists, agencies. Niche but effective.

WHAT B12 DOES WELL

SERVICE BUSINESS WORKFLOW

B12 understands how service businesses work. Lead capture ‚Üí consultation booking ‚Üí service delivery ‚Üí invoice ‚Üí payment ‚Üí follow-up. The entire client lifecycle is built-in. Not just a website‚Äîa business operating system.

Designed for services, not adapted from e-commerce.

BUILT-IN BOOKING & CRM

No Zapier needed. No third-party integrations required. Booking system syncs with CRM automatically. Client history visible at a glance. Follow-up reminders built-in. Everything connected seamlessly.

Reduces operational complexity significantly.

CLIENT PORTAL

Clients get their own portal. Book appointments, view history, download invoices, access resources. Professional touch that reduces support overhead. Clients self-service common tasks.

Better client experience = less admin work for you.

WHO B12 IS BUILT FOR

CONSULTANTS

Strategy, marketing, operations, management. Your product is your expertise. B12 handles booking, CRM, invoicing so you can focus on client work.

Ideal fit

THERAPISTS

Mental health, counseling, coaching. Needs secure client management, session scheduling, progress tracking. B12's CRM is built for ongoing client relationships.

Strong match

AGENCIES

Marketing, design, digital agencies. Manage multiple clients, projects, team members. Track billable hours. Generate proposals and contracts.

Designed for teams

COACHES

Life coaching, business coaching, fitness coaching. Session packages, progress tracking, resource sharing. B12 handles the business so you can focus on transformation.

Natural fit

B12 LIMITATIONS

NOT FOR E-COMMERCE

B12 has basic product selling capabilities. If you're selling physical goods, digital products, subscriptions‚Äîchoose 10Web + WooCommerce or Shopify instead. B12 is purpose-built for services, not retail.

DESIGN LIMITATIONS

Templates are functional, not stunning. 7.0/10 design quality. Gets the job done but won't win awards. If design is your competitive advantage, Framer or Squarespace serve better.

NO CODE EXPORT

Your site is locked to B12 hosting. Can't download code. Can't migrate without rebuilding. If portability matters, this is a significant limitation.

THE BOTTOM LINE ON B12

B12 is niche, and that's intentional. It serves service businesses exceptionally well. Consultants, therapists, agencies, coaches‚ÄîB12 understands your workflow because it was built for you.

For product businesses, choose an e-commerce specialist. For design-first brands, choose Framer or Squarespace. For everyone else selling services, B12 deserves serious consideration.

If you're in the service business and want an all-in-one platform that just works‚ÄîB12 is purpose-built for your needs.

B12 AI WEBSITE BUILDER REVIEW
Why This Platform Doesn't Make the Top List

Brutal honesty: Better alternatives exist for most users

WHAT B12 AI ACTUALLY IS

üîç B12 is Booking.com's AI website builder for hospitality

Industry-specific features for hotels, restaurants, and travel businesses.
But for general use, better alternatives exist.

‚ö° The B12 Advantage

‚úÖ What B12 Does:

  • ‚Ä¢ AI-powered website generation
  • ‚Ä¢ Booking.com integration (if applicable)
  • ‚Ä¢ Industry-specific templates
  • ‚Ä¢ Contact form and scheduling
  • ‚Ä¢ Mobile-responsive design
  • ‚Ä¢ Basic SEO features

üéØ Perfect For:

  • ‚Ä¢ Hotels using Booking.com
  • ‚Ä¢ Restaurants needing reservations
  • ‚Ä¢ Travel agencies
  • ‚Ä¢ Hospitality businesses
  • ‚Ä¢ Service-based businesses

‚ö†Ô∏è Why B12 Doesn't Make the Top List

Mediocre Quality:

  • ‚ùå AI quality 6-7/10 (vs Mixo 7.5-8/10)
  • ‚ùå Design quality 6-7/10 (vs Framer 9.5/10)
  • ‚ùå Limited template variety
  • ‚ùå Basic customization options
  • ‚ùå No code export capability

Not Competitive:

  • ‚ùå Pricing not better than alternatives
  • ‚ùå No unique features vs competitors
  • ‚ùå General purpose features weaker
  • ‚ùå Niche focus limits broad appeal

B12 VS COMPETITORS

üîç B12 vs Framer

B12:

  • ‚Ä¢ Design quality 6-7/10
  • ‚Ä¢ AI quality 6-7/10
  • ‚Ä¢ Hospitality focus
  • ‚Ä¢ No code export

Framer:

  • ‚Ä¢ Design quality 9.5/10
  • ‚Ä¢ AI quality 7-8/10
  • ‚Ä¢ General purpose (any industry)
  • ‚Ä¢ Code export available

Verdict: Framer wins on design and flexibility

üîç B12 vs Mixo

B12:

  • ‚Ä¢ AI quality 6-7/10
  • ‚Ä¢ Limited templates
  • ‚Ä¢ Hospitality niche
  • ‚Ä¢ Basic features

Mixo:

  • ‚Ä¢ AI quality 7.5-8/10
  • ‚Ä¢ 50+ template variety
  • ‚Ä¢ General purpose
  • ‚Ä¢ Better blog features

Verdict: Mixo wins on AI content quality and templates

üîç B12 vs Durable

B12:

  • ‚Ä¢ Similar AI quality
  • ‚Ä¢ Hospitality focus
  • ‚Ä¢ Variable pricing
  • ‚Ä¢ No flat pricing option

Durable:

  • ‚Ä¢ AI quality 7.5-8/10
  • ‚Ä¢ General purpose
  • ‚Ä¢ Flat $180/year (no renewal hike)
  • ‚Ä¢ Faster 30-second launch

Verdict: Durable wins on pricing and speed

WHO SHOULD CONSIDER B12

‚úÖ Choose B12 If:

  • ‚úÖ Using Booking.com for bookings
  • ‚úÖ Hospitality business (hotel, restaurant)
  • ‚úÖ Need Booking.com integration
  • ‚úÖ Industry-specific features required
  • ‚úÖ Travel agency or tour operator
  • ‚úÖ Service-based hospitality business
  • ‚úÖ Okay with mediocre design quality
  • ‚úÖ Hospitality niche outweighs general features

‚ùå Avoid B12 If:

  • ‚ùå Not in hospitality industry
  • ‚ùå Design quality is priority
  • ‚ùå Need premium aesthetic
  • ‚ùå Want code export capability
  • ‚ùå AI content quality is priority
  • ‚ùå Template variety matters
  • ‚ùå General purpose website needed
  • ‚ùå Better alternatives fit your needs

FINAL VERDICT: B12 AI

B12 is only for hospitality businesses using Booking.com integration.

Brutal truth: Unless you need Booking.com integration, choose Framer, Mixo, or Durable instead

Hospitality with Booking.com: B12 may be worth considering for the integration.
Premium design needed: Framer ($240-360/year) for 9.5/10 design quality.
Content quality priority: Mixo ($180-300/year) for best AI content generation.
Budget-conscious: Durable ($180/year flat) for best long-term value.
WordPress needed: 10Web ($360/year renewal) for WooCommerce and plugins.
For everyone else: B12 offers no compelling reason vs these better alternatives.

---

B12 AI:
AI-ASSISTED SIMPLICITY

B12 enhances traditional website building with AI tools - template-based builder with AI content generation, adequate design, and budget pricing. Is AI assistance enough to compete with pure AI platforms?

WHAT B12 AI OFFERS

AI-ASSISTED BUILDING

Traditional templates enhanced with AI content generation. Not pure AI generation, but AI assistance. Choose template, use AI to fill content. Faster than writing from scratch. More control than pure AI builders.

ADEQUATE TEMPLATES

Template variety across industries and styles. Not best-in-class but sufficient. Modern design sensibility. Mobile-responsive layouts. Professional enough for most small businesses.

BUDGET PRICING

Competitive pricing, free tier available. Affordable for cost-conscious users. Similar price point to Mixo and Durable. Good value for basic sites.

LIMITATIONS

NOT TRULY INNOVATIVE

AI features feel bolted-on, not core to product. Me-too AI implementation. Doesn't push boundaries like Framer or Durable. Safe incremental improvements, not revolutionary.

BASIC AI FEATURES

Content generation is primary AI capability. Limited design AI. Can't generate entire site from prompt like competitors. AI assists but doesn't lead.

MIDDLE GROUND COMPROMISE

Neither fastest nor most flexible option. Stuck between traditional and AI-first. Mixo and Durable faster. Framer and Webflow more powerful. B12 occupies awkward middle ground.

WHO IS B12 FOR?

APPROPRIATE FOR:

Users wanting traditional control with some AI help. Small businesses with straightforward needs. Budget-conscious users. Those who prefer template selection over AI prompts.

BETTER ALTERNATIVES EXIST:

Mixo/Durable for pure AI speed and simplicity. Framer for design quality and AI generation. Squarespace for professional templates. B12 doesn't excel at anything specific. Adequate but unremarkable in crowded market.

HONEST VERDICT: B12 is an adequate budget option with basic AI features. But adequate doesn't justify choosing it over superior options. For AI generation, Mixo and Durable are faster and better. For templates, Squarespace offers superior quality. For design, Framer delivers more impressive results. B12 exists in a crowded middle ground without clear advantage. Choose only if its specific balance happens to match your needs.
